author: Toriqul Islam
title: 'My favourite Bangla word'
text:
Toriqul Islam and Kohinur Khyum | Update: 13:29, Feb 21, 2017 | Print Edition 
What comes to your mind when you have to pick your most favourite word in Bangla?In a video interview, people from different walks of life used their favourite word in Bangla.Maa, the Bangla word for mother, is perhaps the first word most of people utter in Bangladesh.When people of different ages and professions were asked to choose their most favourite word in Bangla, Maa trumps all other words.However, Supti, a college student, picks Baba (Bangla word for father) as her favourite word.A policeman said, it's 'Boro apa', the Bangla word for elder sister.Out of myriad Bangla words, people would probably love the words they use to call their loved ones.Fairuz, a camera-shy schoolgirl, said her favourite Bangla word is Pakhi (bird) although she was trying so hard to explain why it is her favourite word.A college student said his favouirte word is Podarthabiggyan (physics). 
Physics! Really?He said his most favourit subject has become his most favourite word. Bangladesh, Kathal (jackfruit), Sammyo (equity), Shokal (morning), Bondhu (friend), Sattya (truth) are some of the words that a few more people pick when they were asked to choose the favourite Bangla words.
